citations.narrative:
In an enclosure housing 4 pheasants and 3 guinea fowl the 4 pheasants were observed with generalized feather loss.
When inquiring on the condition of the 4 pheasants the facility representative stated the pheasants are plucking the
feathers of each other and this is a common occurrence with this species. Failure to house birds in compatible groups
even with their own species can result in unnecessary distress to the birds and excessive feather plucking can lead to
skin issues and negatively affect the health and well-being of the birds. The facility must ensure birds are not housed with
other animals, including members of their own species, unless they are compatible to ensure their health and well-being.
Correct by 16 August 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
End of report.
Additional Inspectors:
Eric Irvin, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
3.160(b) 
   
Compatibility and separation 
In an enclosure housing 4 pheasants and 3 guinea fowl the 4 pheasants were observed with generalized feather loss. 
When inquiring on the condition of the 4 pheasants the facility representative stated the pheasants are plucking the 
feathers of each other and this is a common occurrence with this species. Failure to house birds in compatible groups 
even with their own species can result in unnecessary distress to the birds and excessive feather plucking can lead to 
skin issues and negatively affect the health and well-being of the birds. The facility must ensure birds are not housed with 
other animals, including members of their own species, unless they are compatible to ensure their health and well-being.  
Correct by 16 August 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative. 
 
End of report. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Eric Irvin, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
